p:
Novel technologies aimed at promoting hemostasis in patients with hemophilia without replacing the deficient factor are currently in clinical development. These include FVIII mimics
49– 52 and agents that obstruct the function of natural anti-coagulants, such as antithrombin (AT)
53, 54 , tissue factor pathway inhibitor (TFPI)
55– 59 , and activated protein C (APC)
60, 61 .
